metadata.name: Primordial #24
metadata.description:
Primordial is a study of abstract forms. The algorithm, written in p5.js and WebGL, utilizes domain warping to create twisted fields of color and then overlays thousands of tiny lines to provide depth and texture. The outputs are chaotic but not completely formless, like a swirling mass of plasma from the early universe, or a strange proto-life form suspended in prehistoric ooze.

CONTROLS:

1-9: Increase resolution and save image in PNG format

B: Toggle borders on/off

F: Fullscreen
P: Portrait
L: Landscape
S: Square

For third party license information, please see license.md

David Brice Allen
October 2022

metadata.name: abstract oil painting #74
metadata.description: Over time, the "brush" will spread the paint all over the canvas.

metadata.name: Your Shadow Demon Fren #130
metadata.description:
To celebrate Halloween, a portal to the shadow world has opened up and a Shadow Demon Fren has emerged to follow you home. 

----

8 backgrounds - equal rarity
12 eyes - equal rarity
15 shadow parts - larger frens + trait = more rare
9 mouths - equal rarity
8 textures - mostly equal, but" circus" and "zaaaap" are rare and "slimy halloween" is common.

----
Thanks to @purespider for his image composition code.
4% royalties go to the minter, so go buck wild and mint a shadow demon army!
50% of primary and royalties go towards funding future #darktez events!

metadata.name: Sixty# #40
metadata.description:
This idea was born from recent discussion on generative art and the path the medium is finding for itself. The project aims to take aesthetic concepts from sci fi graphic novels and blend them with generative systems of abstraction. 

The debate is between using previously established art forms to influence this new medium, or using a new medium to meticulously reproduce a previous medium. I believe there‚Äôs room to explore the full spectrum, and I am attempting to find the midpoint that fits my work and brings me the most happiness.

The title describes the eventual aesthetic objective, which is to create a piece which might look like a splash page a colorist alone has been given the freedom to design and explore their own specialty. It explores centralized polar compositions, vibrant colors, plus lots and lots of movement. 60# paper is a standard weight for printing of comic books and graphic novels.

Press ‚Äôs‚Äô in live view to save a .png

Created with p5.js and chroma.js

metadata.name: Cold Mountain #152
metadata.description:
An impressionistic painting of a maintain on a foggy winter's day. The view will be of a mountain, mountain range, valley, or meadow. At nite, the lights come on, and the trees glow in the moonlight.

The image size is 928x1200. Press 's' to save a screenshot.

Common features:
- mountain size and stroke quality
- line quality of the trees
- 50/50 to have a spiral around the sun
- large palette with different application methods

Uncommon
- outline of the first mountain and sun
- amplified color/hue shifting

Rare
- nighttime
- no sun

metadata.name: All√©gories bool√©ennes #197
metadata.description:
"All√©gories bool√©ennes" is part of the fxhash interactive minting experience at PARIS+ par Art Basel

This work is a continuation of research around the intersections of shapes that I have been exploring for a while. I wonder about the way in which they make it possible to bring out new compositions from superpositions of shapes that could initially represent a real disorder.

Controls:
‚Ä¢ "a": Play the animation
‚Ä¢ "s": Export the image (default 2160‚Ää√ó‚Ää3840px PNG)
‚Ä¢ "h": Change export settings to high resolution (then press "s" to export a 6480‚Ää√ó11520px PNG)
‚Ä¢ "m": Change export settings to medium resolution (then press "s" to export a 4320‚Ää√ó‚Ää7680px PNG)
‚Ä¢ "n": Back to 2160‚Ää√ó‚Ää3840px

Artwork by Julien Espagnon, 2022.

metadata.name: Beyond #232
metadata.description:
I have often looked at images from space and wished there were some way I could travel to the far off stars, galaxies, and nebulae, to see them with my own eyes. This project captures glimpses of these distant places. Come discover previously unseen reaches of the universe one mint at a time!

This project includes the following features: color palette, number of stars, total star layers, and number of nebulae.

metadata.name: Scaffold #197
metadata.description:
The thoughts we have are rarely as ordered as the words we speak and the actions we take are shaped by expectation and conditioning.

As we grow up, we are taught to behave or even think in a certain way. We learn what is acceptable and what is not. Our thoughts are forced to align with the structure imposed upon us.

Scaffold is an attempt to visually explore this concept of thoughts and control. Each output represents a state of mind at a particular moment in time.

Palettes have been mostly named by my family based on the first word they thought of when they saw them.

Keyboard commands:

s - save as png
h - toggle high resolution‚Ä®
b - toggle background texture
a - switch aspect ratio
r - new moment

metadata.name: Toccata #402
metadata.description:
Toccata is a piece about decay, about the impermanent. The emergence over time or, rather, progression of entropy is a key characteristic of our universe. Everything evolves to nothing. We as mortal beings have sometimes trouble reconciling with this idea. Humans have sought immortality for millennia, be it through ancient potions or modern medicine, be it from leaving a legacy that we feel will stand the test of time. It will, only to decay later than us.

Toccata is a piece about change. Change lies at the heart of human cognition and human nature. Our thoughts and our emotions happen over time, and are a function of the change that is both around us and at the very core of our selves. Change comes in nature in cycles. Seasons of growth, seasons of ripe fruits of life, seasons of decay, of death, rebirth.

Toccata is music. We find music to convey some of the deepest streams of human condition, connecting it to some other form of being. Music also happens over time, and music happens because of change. Music encodes our feelings better than any other aid we may have. Toccata incorporates this at its very core, as the main sound is Andreas' family piano where he learned to play, sampled this past July.

Read more about the piece, and the collaboration between Marcelo and Andreas on andreasrau.eu/toccata

---

Basic controls:
- Click on the piece or press spacebar to start it (WebAudio requires user intervention for the music to start). Once the music has started, again click or press spacebar to play/pause.
- Press ‚Äús‚Äù to save a still at the current resolution
- Press ‚Äúr‚Äù to start recording a video at the current resolution, then ‚Äúr‚Äù again to stop.

---

WebM audio-video recording performed using the library RecordRTC by https://muazkhan.com/, MIT licence.

metadata.name: GEN XYZ Das Occult #2057
metadata.description:
A 10k Generative Profile Pic collection
GEN XYZ Das Occult - by culla - @tamccullough

move over cryptopunks
there is a new group on the scene

100% code - not an image composition

A bunch of common palettes
A selection of rare palettes
And a smaller set of ultra rare palettes
However, rarity will be based on what combinations the code produces

The majority of tokens will not have a special trait
However your token might have one or even multiple special traits
But, be aware that only the last special trait added will be listed in the features

Even then, look closely, because not all aspects of the canvas are included in the features. Collectors should still look closely and choose what they like when buying on secondary.

Which team are you on? X or O?

follow culla on twitter for updates. Or maybe __acolyte__

If the non reserved tokens mint out quickly, Access List mints will have 24 hours to mint reserves assigned to those wallets

Thank you for supporting an emerging artist in the generative art space

Access List reserves were given to holders of the following PFP collections created by culla
2x for each Basqunk held
1x for each Inkspunk, TwoFourQunk, V0iD, DeeManz, Punkasso and CR0$$KULL
You would have needed to transfer the above tokens to your mint wallet at the time of the snapshot

share your tokens on social media with #genxyznft
Made with love by culla using p5.js

metadata.name: flower.pack #40
metadata.description: Generative art by Mark Knol (@mknol)

metadata.name: GRAPHEME #6
metadata.description:
Released on the occasion of the Tribute to Herbert W. Franke. 
www.tribute-hwf.com

‚ÄúOne criterion for art involves the process used by the artist for shaping the work. In the special case of mathematically supported fine art, the artmaking process occurs in a mathematically defined operation that allows the generation and transformation of images, methods used for picture processing.‚Äù - Herbert W. Franke

I first came across Franke‚Äôs ‚ÄòOrnamental Alphabets‚Äô in his book ùòäùò∞ùòÆùò±ùò∂ùòµùò¶ùò≥ ùòéùò≥ùò¢ùò±ùò©ùò™ùò§ùò¥ - ùòäùò∞ùòÆùò±ùò∂ùòµùò¶ùò≥ ùòàùò≥ùòµ, and was intrigued with the idea of using a simple letterform to explore different generative image processing techniques. 

I‚Äôve used letters and writing in my work for a long time, both with letterpress printing and in my asemic poetry programs. With asemic writing, I generate unrecognizable letters to reference text, and here I use recognizable letterforms removed from their typical function as language signifiers. 

My goal with this project was to build as much texture and layering as possible by warping and collaging the letters together in various ways. The font I‚Äôm using is a design I made years ago to supplement my wood type collection for printing. I really enjoyed being able to bring that part of my past work into my generative art practice. 

Each image is composed of the letters found in the hash for that piece, divided into either vowels or consonants. The program builds on a technique I‚Äôve used before, where I generate an image to an off-screen canvas and then dive through the pixels to pull out the color and form I want to surface in the final image.

25% of the primary sales will be donated on-chain to the Foundation Herbert W. Franke. These funds will be used by ZKM Karlsruhe to digitize Franke‚Äôs 1,800 manuscripts and make them publicly available. Any additional funds raised will be donated to the R√ºtgers Foundation which supports children and young adults in Africa so that they can get access to and work with technology.

- Press ‚ÄúR‚Äù to increase the pixel density and reload the image (this can be render intensive and will create a really large file suitable for printing)
- Press ‚ÄúS‚Äù to save a copy

Made with p5js
Artist: Sarah Ridgley
October, 2022

metadata.name: Indistinct Places #19
metadata.description:
There's a certain state you fall into when you're half asleep that feels very warm and nostalgic. Most of the time, you imagine places or situations that are a mixture of the familiar and the unfamiliar, a strange brew of your past and the future you desire.
"Indistinct Places" is a tribute to this fuzzy state.

/////

Takes a long time to render.
In case you get bored: click on the canvas to start the algorithmic audio.

key "1" - "6": increases the render resolution by 2x with each step
-> These will automatically export a png after the simulation is done.
(Alternatively, you can contact me on Twitter and i can render a high res file in the size you need).

key "s": saves a png with the current resolution

Tone.js is used for the audio.

metadata.name: A Less Traveled Path #186
metadata.description:
"I shall be telling this with a sigh
Somewhere ages and ages hence:
Two roads diverged in a wood, and I‚Äî
I took the one less traveled by,
And that has made all the difference."

- Robert Frost, The Road Not Taken



=========

Controls:
[1] set resolution to 1024x1024 (default)
[2] set resolution to 2048x2048 
[3] set resolution to 4096x4096
[0] set resolution to window size (might help on lower end computers)

[c] capture a screenshot at rendered resolution


Made with cables.gl, a node-based webgl environment
XALTED 2022

metadata.name: HOPONO #3
metadata.description:
I‚ÄôM SORRY / PLEASE FORGIVE ME / THANK YOU / I LOVE YOU
Ho'Oponopono is an ancient Hawaiian spiritual practice that involves learning to heal all things by accepting "Total Responsibility" for everything that surrounds us ‚Äì confession, repentance, and reconciliation. 
This practice has been part of the French street artist Arthur Simony‚Äôs creation for a while, on paper, canvas‚Ä¶ and now on the TEZ blockchain!
Original piece by Arthur Simony - October 2022 - Paris, France
Powered by David Ughetto @_dugh x Guillaume Horen @guillaumeh

metadata.name: Broken Symmetries #1/3 #27
metadata.description:
"It was the best of times, it was the worst of times, it was the age of wisdom, it was the age of foolishness, it was the epoch of belief, it was the epoch of incredulity, it was the season of Light, it was the season of Darkness, it was the spring of hope, it was the winter of despair, we had everything before us, we had nothing before us..."
                                      Charles Dickens

This piece is the first in a planed series of three intended as studies on composition.

It is built entirely on thi.ng/umbrella libraries and template:

https://github.com/thi-ng/fxhash-tpl

Keyboard shortcuts

- 1 : render @ original resolution
- 2 : render @ 2 x resolution
- 4 : render @ 4 x resolution
- x : download canvas as PNG @ current resolution
- s : download canvas as SVG @ current resolution; This can be used with a plotter.

metadata.name: ghetin #63
metadata.description:
Opinionated m√∂bius segments.

Press 's' or double click/tap to save a PNG version.
Press 'd' to save a higher resolution PNG version.
Press 'v' to save a SVG version.

Using tinycolor2, p5-noise and lineclip.
